unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Screen Time
question_text:
A data scientist reads the average screen time for high school students is approximately $8$ hours a day. To investigate, the data scientist collects multiple random samples of $40$ high school students and calculates the average screen time for each sample. He then summarizes the data on the dotplot below:
What proportion of samples produced a mean of $8$ hours or more?
solution:
When looking at the distribution of sample means with a sample of size
40
, you can see the data scientist took
28
samples of size
40
. Therefore, to find the proportion of samples that produced a mean of
8
or more hours, you need to count the observations at
8
or more. When counting the observations, you can see there are
5
observations at
8
or more.

Therefore, the proportion of observations that produce a sample mean of
8
or more hours is
5
28
=
0.179
.

Choice 'D' is correct.
